> [{quoted}](name=LordGeovanni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qNG8rNpE,comment-id=000000000000000200000001000000000002,timestamp=2018-04-20T03:36:16.134+0000)

Keep in mind that being a tank in LoL means something different than just 'being tanky'. Tanks that deal damage and have little CC are called Juggernauts so in the end tanks are strong due to doing what they are supposed to do - they are simply too good at it, or rather: fighters are too bad at doing their job.

Being a tank means being tanky and melee. 
The perversion of what tanks do is why people have so many problems with tanks in Lol. There is also that they want tanks to deal no damage when they are getting hit by a tank as supposed to be the squishiest champions in the game.  Tanks also have massive delays for counter play in melee range. But isnt the counterplay for melee range skills supposed to be that they have to be used in melee range and thus are limited in when they can be used. while ranged skills are much less limited. Even point in click has a limit in that something must be there to click on while you can run away fire a line skill shot at some one who is out of your range and it hits them because they walk into your range while you continue to run which is impossible with a point and click ability that generally have short range.

Where do people get the idea that tanks are dominating? If you look at win rates, you can easily see that tank win rates are lower than fighter win rates. Their competitive strength isn't the same as their strength in solo queue.

The problem with tanks in soloQ is that every autofilled player plays tanks (and many people get filled top as people stopped playing it) and that tank players are way less dedicated to specific champions than carry players, meaning that they are just worse on their respective champions. If you go by winrate/avg games played tanks look very strong.

Then of course we've got 1-3 with an average of two tanks in every competitive comp. And worst of all, this is probably the carry heaviest meta we've got in several years.

I'm not denying the fact that fighters are more popular than tanks on average. I'm suggesting there are other factors influencing their numbers.

I agree with the fact that this is a carry heavy meta. However, with the current strength of adcs means that damage can be sacrificed elsewhere for utility. I'm suggesting that this is a reason for the win rates.

If you take a look at the win rates vs kills - deaths, tanks being ahead means less for the outcome of the game than fighters being ahead. 

On top of that, my issues with tanks are that they aren't tanky. What's keeping them around is their cc. Even then, the difference in their play rates are a large indicator of their strength, and many have been on the decline in the past few months, even considering their low play rates in the past.

> I agree with the fact that this is a carry heavy meta. However, with the current strength of adcs means that damage can be sacrificed elsewhere for utility. I'm suggesting that this is a reason for the win rates.

Oh, I don't think that this is a carry heavy meta, I think that this is a meta that looks like a carry heavy meta in comparison to the last three years. 

> If you take a look at the win rates vs kills - deaths, tanks being ahead means less for the outcome of the game than fighters being ahead. 

That's just in the nature of how tanks work, tanks being behind means barely anything on the other hand so being a bad player doesn't really get punished.

> On top of that, my issues with tanks are that they aren't tanky. What's keeping them around is their cc. Even then, the difference in their play rates are a large indicator of their strength, and many have been on the decline in the past few months, even considering their low play rates in the past.

It really depends who they are fighting against - toplaners struggle killing tanks right now as the resolve tree is really strong and their options to kill them got nerfed (mainly BC), while ADC's have cheap AS+Crit powerspikes that allow them to shred through tanks.
I don't particularly care about marksmen vs tanks as tanks are not competing with marksmen for being picked, I care about fighters being too weak against tanks right now.

>  toplaners struggle killing tanks right now as the resolve tree is really strong

Yes, but the resolve tree is not significantly stronger on tanks than it is on bruisers or the like. 
Runes like bone plating give flat damage reduction, which is just as good on tanks as it is on squishies. 
Aftershock gives flat resistances, which is hypothetically just as useful on tanks as anything else (which is the reason why galio and riven ran it despite building offensively).
And what about teemo gnar kennen etc, remove them from the game?
I would be okay with yordles in general being removed  {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/ziggs
http://champion.gg/champion/Ziggs/Middle?
http://www.op.gg/champion/ziggs/statistics/mid

Ziggs simply isn't fun to play against when he is decently strong, as he just plays as far away as possible while clearing up waves after waves. Nothing interactive in playing against him.

And the Yordles you mentioned are oppressive only when they are chosen as counterpicks, with the exception of Nunu, who has an ancient kit, and Tristana, who depends on the meta of Bot Lane. And no, Trist did not rule Bot Lane for most of seasons, that is an exaggeration. She was a top pick alongside Lucian in season 4, and meta alongside Twitch, Kog and Varus in season 7. Outside of those seasons, she wasn't that great of a pick.

Anyway, I find the current Veigar the least toxic between all of them while also being a decent pick.
